subject: Psychology
title: The Compound Effect of Habits
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Compound Effect of Habits.

hook.text: Getting 1% better each day seems trivial. Over a year, you'd be 37 times better. Habits compound like interest.

buildup.text: Small habits don't feel meaningful in the moment. Their power is invisible â€” until the results suddenly appear.

discovery.text: James Clear calls this the plateau of latent potential. Results lag behind effort, then arrive all at once.

twist.text: This is also why bad habits are dangerous. Small declines compound into large problems before you notice.

climax.text: Your outcomes are a lagging indicator of your habits. Today's actions are writing tomorrow's results.

punchline.text: Habits are compound interest for self-improvement.

quiz.question: What does the compound effect of habits mean?
options: Small consistent actions accumulate into large results over time
Compounding only applies to financial investments
